definition[0]: a non-negotiable principle or belief is one that you refuse to discuss or change
example[0]: He emphasized that the government’s anti-nuclear position was non-negotiable.
definition[1]: a cheque, bond etc that is non-negotiable can only be exchanged for money by the person whose name is on it
definition[2]: if a financial document such as a cheque is non-negotiable, it cannot be used by the person or organization receiving it to pay a third person or organization. CROSSED CHEQUEs are non-negotiable
definition[3]: if someone says that a demand, condition etc is non-negotiable, they mean that they are not willing to accept other suggestions, conditions etc
example[1]: To think we can compromise on raising the fuel tax is wrong; it’s non-negotiable.
